courses.description: The course will examine the economy-wide phenomena including inflation, unemployment, economic growth and international trade. In additional to macroeconomic measures, related economic models will be developed to explain the performance of the economy both in the long run and in the short run. Furthermore, we are going to discuss the related policy tools used by the government to influence the economy as a whole.Upon completion of the course, the students shall be capable of achieving the following objectives:1. To be able to understand the important macroeconomics fundamentals.2. To be able to effectively identify the macroeconomic problems or issues and look for appropriate solutions in the practical setting. 3. To be able to actively acquire new knowledge regarding development of the economy. 4. To be able to develop the interpretation and communication skill for macroeconomic data. 本課程主要是延續上學期的經濟學(一)，然這學期側重在總體經濟學的介紹。

syllabus.zh: 1. 國民所得的衡量(CH23)2. 生活成本的衡量(CH24)3. 經濟成長(CH25)4. 儲蓄投資與金融體系(CH26)5. 失業與自然失業率(CH28)6. 貨幣體系(CH29)7. 貨幣供給與通貨膨脹(CH30)8. 國際貿易(CH31-32)
syllabus.en: The course will cover the following important topics:1. Measuring output: GDP2. Measuring costs of living: CPI3. Wage and employment4. Economic growth in the long run5. Saving, investment and financial market6. Monetary system, money supply and inflation7. Economic fluctuation in the short run8. Fiscal policy and financial policy9. Aggregate demand and aggregate supply10. International economics

courses.description: This course serves as an introduction to the discipline of management.  It is designed to integrate the accepted theories in the area with real world applications to provide students with the basic knowledge and skills needed for managing others. This course begins with a discussion of the current issues in management and then proceeds to cover the traditional functions of management: planning, organizing, leading, and controlling. Lecture and class assignments given in the course are intended to help students understand the needs of modern public and private organizations, including emerging national and international trends.本課程乃是希望讓同學了解，社會上有這麼多組織，為何其間的績效常有極大差別？主要內容包括：組織的意義、相關理論的演進，以及管理功能的介紹等。在課程中會提到許多國內外企業的案例，而修課同學在期末也必須進行分組，選擇一家企業來進行分析，並且完成書面報告。

courses.description: Being the most-up-to-date technology in an ever-changing discipline, this course emphasizes an in-depth understanding of why computers are essential in business and society. Students will have a solid understanding of computers and how to use computers. Specifically, students will be taught to understand the fundamentals of and terms associated with computers and mobile devices, the Internet, and digital security. Upon completion of the course, the students shall be capable of achieving the following objectives:1. To be able to understand the fundamentals of computers and mobile devices. 2. To be able to understand the terms associated with computers and mobile devices.3. To be able to understand how to use computers and how to access information on the Web.4. To be able to effectively identify the computer-related problems or issues and look for appropriate solutions.5. to teach students programming concepts and how to do logical analysis.

syllabus.zh: 一、計算機概論課程簡介1.EXCEL軟體主要內容及發展二、商用軟體基礎認識1. 公司基本資料庫與客戶資料建置2. 人事資料與財會資料庫建置3. 帳務系統與財務作業解析4. 進銷存管理表單建立5. 庫房作業登錄與後台資料建置6. 樞紐分析應用三、製作圖形化的報表1. 報表管理與群組列印2. 簡易繪圖與圖形報表四、辦公室E化的幫手1. 線上資料分析與更新2. 特殊函數的使用3. 網路資料擷取與更新五、實戰練習1.TQC(電腦技能基金會)題庫練習六、財會資料整合1.EXCEL與資料庫連結2.自動更新與批次修訂

courses.description: In your career, you will often come across the situation that you have to convince your colleague, your boss, your customers, or that other people try to convince you. How do you present solid argument to support your statement, or how do you discern whether other people offer valid argument to convince you? How do I know whether the information I receive from the mass media or the internet is correct? How do you apply these principles to construct and analyze your business models?This course aims to provide solutions to these questions by introducing the basic notions of logic and scientific methods. The goals include1.to equip the you with the power of reasoning, forming and discerning arguments, and critical thinking.2.to learn the basic scientific methods, as a foundation to your further study and future career.

syllabus.zh: A.科學思維1.基本邏輯概念2.論點的分析：論點的構成要素與型態3.論點的評估：歸納與演繹推理，謬誤4.邏輯推理解謎B.科學方法1.因果分析2.機率3.統計推理4.假設與科學推理
syllabus.en: A.Scientific Reasoning1.Basic concept of logic2.Analyzing arguments: elements and types of arguments3.Evaluating arguments: inductive/deductive reasoning, and fallacies4.Puzzle analysis and solvingB.Scientific Methods1.Causal reasoning2.Probability3.Statistical reasoning4.Hypothesis and scientific reasoning

courses.description: 本課程廣泛採用多媒體、原始資料及文學作品等媒材，介紹當代美國歷史與文化之相關主題、概念及事件，期學生覺知與理解20世紀的關鍵事件與文化現象如何型塑當代社會。This course is designed to introduce topics, concepts and issues related to contemporary U.S. history and culture through a wide range of media, primary source material and literature in order to promote awareness and understanding of how important key events and cultural phenomena in the 20th century have shaped our world today.

syllabus.zh: 學生藉由選讀原始資料、二手資料與官方檔案，以及觀賞大量多媒體素材，以了解20世紀主要歷史事件之影響，如第一次世界大戰與冷戰；以及大眾文化特色，如音樂、運動及電影等。本課程之目的在激發學生討論，並自力完成20世紀歷史文化發展特色之研究。期透過課堂討論、文本閱讀、大眾媒體視聽及PPT報告，加強學生對當代美國歷史文化的興趣及理解。
syllabus.en: Through primary source material, excerpts from secondary sources, official documents, and a variety of other media students will realize the effects of key events, such as World War I and the Cold War, as well as popular cultural features such as music, sports and movies. The goal of this course is to foster discussion as well as to allow students to do their own research into key figures of the 20th century. Through class discussions, readings, mass media and their own PPT presentations it is hoped that students will have a greater appreciation for U.S. history and culture.

courses.weeklySchedule: 1)	Interactive, look at your perspectives of history and its importance2)	Worldwide historical dates worth knowing3)	Worldwide historical events worth knowing4)	Historical quotes…discussion and preferences.5)	Cultural outlooks and opinions.6)	The Clintons7)	Edward Snowdon: Whistleblowers. What is your moral stand?8)	Mid term presentations9)	World wide history: Julian Assange10)	Africa, roots origins and connection to present11)	Education for all!12)	Debating, importance of rhetoric and values.13)	Black rights.14)	How one human’s stand against oppression can make a difference.15)	Civil Rights, what happened to all the leaders?16)	 Media and its control17)	Reviews18)	Final Reports

courses.description: This course is Introduction to Statistics for undergraduate students in finance. The objective of this course is to lay a foundation on statistical methods and time series analysis for undergraduate students. After the course, students are expected to be familiar with important concepts and develop basic skills in statistical methods and time series analysis. In particular, the course pays special attention to applications in Economics and Finance and thus methods and examples covered are relevant in Economics and Finance.本課程主要介紹推論統計學的基本原理，概念與應用，內容包括t考驗,變異數考驗，變異數分析與實驗設計，適合度與獨立性考驗，以及迴歸分析。

syllabus.zh: 1.假設檢定2.兩母體平均數與比例的統計推論3.母體變異數的推論4.適合度與獨立性的檢定5.變異數分析與實驗設計6.簡單迴歸7.複迴歸8.迴歸分析
syllabus.en: 1. Random variables: expectation, conditional probability & independence2. Some special distributions3. Some special distributions & computer workshop 14. The properties of an estimator, Law of Large Numbers (LLN) & Central Limit Theorem (CLT)5. Statistical inference & hypothesis testing6. Maximum likelihood methods7. Computer workshop 28. Stochastic processes: stationarity, autocorrelation & uncorrelated processes9. AR(1) process & unit-root test10. MA(1) process & computer workshop 311. ARMA models 12. Regression with time series errors13. Computer workshop 414. Summary & coursework presentation

courses.description: The major areas of finance can be summarized into three categories: corporate finance, investment, and financial institutions. This course will mainly focus on corporate finance. Financial management includes the administration and maintenance of financial assets. Besides, financial management covers the process of identifying and managing risks. Financial Management also means planning, organizing, directing and controlling the financial activities such as procurement and allocation of funds of the enterprise.This course is to equip students with the knowledge and capability to make financial decisions and investment decisions. Financial decisions include issues regarding financial planning, capital raising, cost of financing, capital structure, etc. Investment decisions include capital allocation, investment in fixed assets, investment opportunity selection, risk, and return evaluation, etc.

syllabus.zh: 1. 財務管理概論2. 財務報表與現金流量3. 營運資金管理4. 財務報表分析5. 籌資管道與融資實務6. 租稅實務與報稅技巧
syllabus.en: The course will cover the following important topics:1. Financial statement and analysis: using financial ratios to understand the financial situations of a firm2. Financial planning: developing financial forecasts and evaluating future financial needs3. Time value of money: calculating future value, present value, and annuity4. Risk and return: diversification, portfolio, and CAPM5. Capital budgeting: introducing payback period, NPV, and IRR6. Cost of capital: weighted average cost of capital (WACC)7. Leverage: breakeven analysis, operating and financial leverage8. Capital Structure and Dividend Policy

courses.weeklySchedule: - Introduction- Financial statements- Time value of money- Interest rates and bond valuationmidterm exam- Capital budgeting- Risk and return- Cost of capital- Leverage and capital structure- Dividend policyFinal exam

courses.description: This course is organized around an innovative customer-value and customer-relationship framework. Students will learn how to create value through customer connections and engagement. In a fast-changing, increasingly digital and social marketplace, it's more vital than ever for marketers to develop meaningful connections with their customers. Furthermore, students will learn about today's key marketing challenge: to create vibrant, interactive communities of consumers who make products and brands an integral part of their daily lives. To help students understand how to create value and build customer relationships, with fundamental marketing information within an innovative customer-value framework. Moreover, students will learn how companies use new digital technologies to maximize customer engagement and shape brand conversations, experiences, and communities.

courses.description: This course is to provide a comprehensive introduction of basic features in the monetary mechanism and banking system. The modern money system plays a pivotal role in shaping the proper general price level which can ease price inflation’s pressure and even infuse growth momentum into the economy. The central bank, whose money policies bring great impacts on interest rates which can cause changes in asset prices, is the central agent of this field. This course will focus the intense intentions on the contents of various money policies as well as their possible influences on key variables of economy, including general price level, foreign exchange rate, enterprise productivity, economy growth. The details of this course can be categorized into several subgroups which contain the functions of money, the role of the central bank, money creation process and money supply, money demand theories, AD/AS model, etc.

syllabus.zh: 1. 貨幣的意義、貨幣本位制度2. 金融市場簡介3. 利率，匯率，及其決定理論4. 利率期限結構5. 資產需求理論6. 訊息成本與財務結構7. 銀行的業務8. 銀行的種類與管理9. 中央銀行10. 貨幣供給創造模型11. 銀行準備與貨幣供給12. 貨幣需求理論13. 貨幣政策的工具: 存款準備率、重貼現政策與公開市場操作14. 貨幣政策的效果與分析
syllabus.en: The course will cover the following important topics:1. Functions of money 2. Evolution of payments system3. Term structure of interest rates4. Concept of international financial markets5. Banking industry and regulation6. The central bank and money policies7. Money creation process8. Process of money supply9. Money demand theory10. Aggregate supply and aggregate demand model

courses.description: 創意思考(Creative Thinking)是一種特殊的思考的模式，重點在於能產生獨特、有用、有價值、可被應用的點子。本課程主要培養學生(一)藉由跨領域的師資，讓同學知道面對的問題或困難，不同領域是如何分析與面對問題。(二)在解決問題時，如何以發散思考的方式產生大量點子，再經過反覆過濾、評估後，留下最佳的解決方案。(三) 培養學生在團隊中學習溝通與表達能力。

syllabus.zh: 1. 發揮創造力的先決條件2. 形象化與創意空間3. 藝術創作與聯想力4. 水平思維與水性邏輯5. 創造性難題的處理6. 實驗創意

name.en: Case Studies of International Economic and Trade

courses.description: Students will learn the core policies of international trade and their impact on globalization and economic development. Through real-world case studies reflecting global trade issues and challenges as well as contemporary influences, they will apply these concepts to practical situations. The course will foster cross cultural competence, and ethical decision-making by challenging students to grapple with the moral dimensions of international trade, encouraging them to make informed judgments about trade policies, corporate practices, and social responsibility in a global context.

syllabus.zh: 貿易政策關稅和配額非關稅壁壘貿易政策工具貿易自由化及其影響國際貿易機構世界貿易組織（WTO）區域貿易協定（例如北美自由貿易協定、歐盟）雙邊貿易協定貿易爭端解決機制國際貿易與經濟發展貿易在經濟發展中的作用出口導向型成長策略進口替代工業化貿易與減貧全球貿易議題與挑戰貿易失衡與貨幣匯率貿易與環境智慧財產權與貿易數位時代的貿易當代貿易議題貿易戰對全球供應鏈的影響貿易和 COVID-19 大流行大流行後世界全球貿易的未來
syllabus.en: Trade PoliciesTariffs and quotasNon-tariff barriersTrade policy instrumentsTrade liberalization and its effectsInternational Trade InstitutionsWorld Trade Organization (WTO)Regional trade agreements (e.g., NAFTA, EU)Bilateral trade agreementsTrade dispute settlement mechanismsInternational Trade and Economic DevelopmentThe role of trade in economic developmentExport-led growth strategiesImport substitution industrializationTrade and poverty reductionGlobal Trade Issues and ChallengesTrade imbalances and currency exchange ratesTrade and the environmentIntellectual property rights and tradeTrade in the digital ageContemporary Trade IssuesThe impact of trade wars on global supply chainsTrade and the COVID-19 pandemicThe future of global trade in a post-pandemic world

courses.description: This course offers an introduction to understand the operating environment, managerial framework, and relevant empirical issues of international business. One term paper is required each group to encourage students to cooperate with classmates by communication, negotiation, and to enhance abilities of information integration and oral presentation.本課程關心國際企業所面對各國不同之政治、經濟、法律、文化等因素，對於其經營管理之意涵，以及拓展國際市場之海外進入策略。主要內容包括：多國籍企業（MNCs）的意義、國際經營環境、國際經營策略等。

courses.description: This course presents International Monetary Economics theory and applies it towards gaining an understanding of recent events and current policy issues. The theory covers topics including exchange rate determination, balance of payment crises, the choice of exchange rate systems, and international debt.1. 使學生瞭解國際金融市場之概況與相關理論。2. 能具備國際金融工具之概念與操作能力。3. 能具備國際金融從業人員之專業態度。4. 能瞭解國際金融市場之發展狀況。

syllabus.zh: 一、基本概念 1. 國際金融制度2. 國際收支與總體經濟二、匯率與外匯市場工具 1. 即期外匯市場與即期匯率2 遠期外匯市場與遠期匯率3. 匯率選擇權4. 外幣期貨與換匯三、外匯風險管理 1. 交易風險2. 營運風險3. 會計風險四、開放總體模型分析 1. 國際收支之調整與貶值理論2. 開放體系之總體經濟分析3. 購買力平價說4. 資產市場匯率決定理論五、匯率預測1. 匯率預測的目的2. 匯率預測的方法
syllabus.en: The course will cover the following important topics:1. Introduction to international finance.2. Foreign exchange market and exchange rate.3. National Income Accounting and the Balance of Payments.4. Foreign derivative commodity market.5. Purchasing power parity.6. Interest rate parity.7. The International Monetary System.8. Open economics.9. Fixed Exchange Rates and Foreign Exchange Intervention.

courses.description: "Business Ethics" studies the critical, structured examination of how employees and institutions should behave in the world of commerce. It involves examining appropriate constraints on the pursuit of firms’ profits.The objectives of this course include: (1) equipping students with the concept of ethics, moral, and values, (2) helping students to establish a positive business values, (3)helping students to develop an appropriate rules and establish the concept of professional ethics through case discussion.在企業追求利潤的過程就會對資源產生不適當的配置與耗損，衡量企業或個人是否合乎倫理，可從動機、行為、效果（後果）三個層次來看，倫理問題絕不是單純的，也非有絕對的準則，有時動機合乎倫理，但行為就未必是合乎倫理。

syllabus.zh: 企業的社會責任社會價值與企業責任企業公民行為非營利組織的治理與倫理機制綠色企業vs營利企業文化、價值與倫理資訊安全與倫理全球化治理與倫理機制企業個案研討
syllabus.en: The course will cover the following important topics:1. Foundations of Business Ethics2. The Stakeholder Approach to Business, Society, and Ethics3. Corporate Social Responsibility4. Employee Stakeholders5. Consumer Stakeholders6. The Natural Environment as Stakeholder7. Gender Equity

courses.weeklySchedule: wk1 簡介wk2-3 企業的社會責任wk3-4社會價值與企業責任wk5-6企業公民行為wk6-7非營利組織的治理與倫理機制wk8 綠色企業vs營利企業wk10-11文化、價值與倫理wk12-13資訊安全與倫理wk14-15全球化治理與倫理機制wk16-17企業個案研討

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 具備資料蒐集能力以了解企業所面對之倫理問題
能在達成企業目標與使命的過程中，關懷他人或社會的利益
能分析企業所發生的倫理問題，並提出因應之道
能具備人文素養之精神，對企業行為提出反省及批判的能力

courses.description: The course objective is to be help students to understand the definition and scope of industry, and to analyze industry competition with various models. Meanwhile, students are expected to be able to make strategic presentation with an excellent industry report.產業環境分析與企業的管理與策略規劃息息相關，因為企業對市場現況及未來趨勢資訊之解讀不但是企業策略形成的重大頻藉，更是未來企業領導人其領導力以及願景形成的依據，故在全球化、專業化的市場競爭下，培養分析產業環境的技能已成為今日企業人不可或缺的智識。

syllabus.zh: 第1章 動態競爭之介紹：競爭的目的與其背後的理論基礎第2章 產業特質背後的經濟意涵第3章 競爭分析的模式化理論第4章 企業競爭分析模式介紹第5章 分析模式的理論與應用第6章 企業動態競爭的邏輯思維與應用第7章 Case Study I第8章 產業分析方法介紹第9章 產業發展趨勢分析第10章 關鍵成功因素與關鍵存活因素分析第11章 Value Chain Model介紹第12章 產業競爭分析理論介紹第13章 產業競爭力定量分析模式第14章 產業競爭力定性分析模式第15章 Case Study II
syllabus.en: The course will cover the following important topics:1. The definition and scope of industry2. The analysis model of industry competition3. The tool for industrial analysis4. The skill of strategic presentation5. How to write an excellent industry report6. Personal and team work

courses.description: 本課程為社團參與的入門導航課程，主要透過學生參與社團或參與各項活動，培養學生多元課外興趣、團隊合作精神、人際社交能力以及社會關懷意識等教育目標，希望藉由該課程讓學生培養人際關係並把興趣變成技能。

syllabus.zh: 1.	社團活動參與。2.	社團成員加入。
syllabus.en: 1.	Club Activity Attendance.2.	Club Participation.

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 了解社團運作，擔任成員、出席社課，或參與各項活動，了解活動生態與樣貌。
學習與同濟與學長姊互動，透過學習社團知能，學習與人應對相處。
學習團隊經營概念，成為社團一份子或出席社團活動，讓社團活動更加活絡與和諧。
學習人文與倫理素養，加入社團或參與活動奠定踏入社會基礎。

courses.description: This course focus on the following issues: What is Globalization? What does this understanding count? What can we learn from the understandings? And what can we do to cope with Globalization?Various issues/topics concerning Globalization will be introduced, explored, and discussed. Students will present their leaning/reflection during the classes as well as a report at the end of the semester.本課程將從社會科學，人文科學及自然科學的觀點來說明全球化議題。本課程除了課程講授外，更鼓勵學生上課討論提問的方式來探討下列全球化議題。例如：何謂「全球化」?「全球化」與「國際化」有何異同?「全球化」的內涵為何?「全球化」對於國際貿易帶來的利弊與影響為何?更重要的是「全球化」對於人類及地球的影響為何等等攸關全人類的問題。本課程意在擴大學生國際化學術與實用面的視野與瞭解；強化學生掌握職場能力並強化競爭力。

syllabus.zh: 本課程將從全球經濟、環保及政治等面向切入， 深入探討並了解這些命題「全球化」的過程，對於人類所將產生的影響與衝擊，在此同時，本課程亦將從個人、公司、企業、國家、區域等不同場域來解讀人類對於「全球化」議題的回應，作法與政策對應。
syllabus.en: From discussions and readings, we walk toward a fundamental understanding of Globalization. Starting by the teacher’s introduction lectures, students get the outline of Globalization and the process/reason/drives/causes of the Globalization. Readings to relevant topics are assigned to students and feedbacks/reflections are expected after in-class discussions. Political, environmental, business, economic issues and so forth in global perspectives are discoursed.

courses.weeklySchedule: 1. Globalization and the world2. Globalization and Economy3. Globalization and Technology4. Globalization and Environment5. Globalization and Countries6 . Special topics in GlobalizationEach topic will run for 2-3 weeks, depending on learning.

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 了解全球化的意義與衝擊
分析不同領域全球化的影響
理解及思考因應全球化變革的方法
全球化深入議題的探討

courses.description: This course provides basic concepts of enterprise resource planning (ERP). ERP helps an organization manage and integrate internal resources/processes to run business more efficiently. ERP systems integrate business processes across all functional areas, including sales, marketing, manufacturing, finance, and human resources. Modern business people should understand what ERP systems can do for an organization. Students will also gain experiences on using ERP software.

syllabus.zh: 1.	企業資源規劃概論2.	企業流程管理3.	ERP系統模組介紹4.	ERP系統導入之成功因素5.	ERP系統導入流程6.	ERP系統的評估
syllabus.en: 1.	Introduction to ERP2.	Business Process Management3.	Introduction to ERP Modules4.	Key Success Factors for Implementing ERP5.	Steps for Implementing ERP6.	Evaluation of ERP

courses.description: 供應鏈金融是金融機構運用供應鏈完整資訊對於大型中心廠與中小企業供應商所提供的整合型融資，本課程介紹供應鏈金融最新實務與發展，培養學生未來從事本業務的基礎能力。Supply chain finance is a set of solutions that optimizes cash flow by allowing businesses to lengthen their payment terms to their suppliers while providing the option for their large and SME suppliers to get paid early. This course introduces the latest practice and development of supply chain finance, and trains students' basic ability to engage in this business in the future.

syllabus.zh: 1 供應鏈金融簡介2 應收帳款承購與供應鏈金融3 應收帳款承購業務介紹4 供應鏈金融對於供應商之優點5 供應鏈金融對於購買方之優點6 供應鏈金融對於金融機構之優點7 供應鏈金融市場運作實務8 供應鏈金融市場於新南向之應用9 買方與賣方之營運資金管理:個案研究10 買方與賣方之聯合組織:個案研究11 抵押貸款、設備融資、租賃:個案研究12 專案融資:個案研究13 貿易融資、遠期信用狀賣斷與擔保信用狀14 合併與收購:個案研究
syllabus.en: 1 Introduction to Supply Chain Finance2 Factoring and Supply Chain Finance3 Different Types in Factoring Business4 Benefit to Supplier under Supply Chain Finance5 Benefit to Anchor Buyer under Supply Chain Finance6 Benefit to Bank/Financial Institution under Supply Chain Finance7 Market Practice in Supply Chain Finance8 Apply SCF in New Southbound Policy9 Working Capital to Supplier and Anchor Buyer, Case Study10 Syndication to Supplier and Anchor Buyer, Case Study11 Mortgage loan, Equipment Finance and Leasing to Supplier and Anchor Buyer, Case Study12 Project Finance and Case Study13 Trade Finance, Forfaiting and Standby Letter of Credit (L/C)14 Merge & Acquisition, and Case Study

name.en: Study of Semiconductor Equipment Associated English

courses.description: 本課程的目標在提升學生科技專業英文的能力，特別是與半導體設備相關的英文字彙與用詞的學習，內容包括半導體生產設備所需的軟硬體英文詞彙、設備運作/故障排除與維護所需的英文對話、半導體設備操作手冊的研讀、基本技術書信溝通等，將配合做中學的學習方法引導學生達成科技英文讀寫的能力提升。

syllabus.zh: 1.半導體設備名稱、結構與功能介紹2.半導體設備操作手冊研讀3.設備操作步驟、故障分析與排除程序4.設備故障排除報告撰寫5.主題式技術書信撰寫
syllabus.en: 1.Introduction of name, architecture and function of semiconductor equipment.2.Reading of operation manual of semiconductor equipment.3.Operation procedure, failure analysis and trouble-shooting of semiconductor equipment.4.Technical report writing of equipment trouble-shooting.5.Writing of technical issue associated letters.

courses.weeklySchedule: WK1-4	半導體設備名稱、結構與功能介紹WK5-8	半導體設備操作手冊研讀WK9	期中作業WK10-13 設備操作步驟、故障分析與排除程序WK14-15	設備故障排除報告撰寫WK16-17	主題式技術書信撰寫WK18    期末作業

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 能以英文撰寫5種以上半導體設備的名稱、結構與功能。
能以英文撰寫3個半導體設備的操作程序與故障分析。
能以英文撰寫1個半導體設備故障排除的技術報告。
能以英文撰寫5個主題的技術書信與設備商溝通。

courses.description: 物聯網 (Internet of Things, IoT) 是近期非常重要也受到高度關注的議題, 主要訴求是"物物聯網"或是"萬物聯網", 就是將全球物件以及各式各樣的感應器 (sensors) 等等也連上網路, 除了資料與數據收集分析外, 也可以回饋進行各種控制, 這對於未來生活的便利性將有極大的影響

syllabus.zh: (1) 物聯網的基礎架構與創新應用(2) 物聯網感知層/網路層/應用層技術(3) IPv6 協議運作原理與 IPv6 最新發展趨勢(4) IPv4/IPv6 轉移機制(5) 物聯網感測器平台 (Sensor Node Platforms)(6) 物聯網感測器網路 (Sensors Networks) 的路由協議 (routing protocols)(7) 物聯網無線傳輸技術(8) 物聯網框架標準 (IoT framework)
syllabus.en: (1) Introduction to IoT Basic Architectures and Its Innovation Applications (2) Introduction to IoT Sensing Layer/Networking Layer/Application Layer Techniques (3) Introduction to IPv6 Protocols Theory and the State of Arts (4) Introduction to IPv4/IPv6 Transfer Mechanism (5) Introduction to IoT Sensor Nodes Platform (6) Introduction to Routing Protocols of IoT Sensor Networks (7) Introduction to IoT Wireless Communications Techniques (8) Introduction to IoT Frameworks

courses.weeklySchedule: 物聯網介紹物聯網的架構與整合智慧居家應用工業物聯網物聯網外網技術物聯網網路應用物聯網感測系統ESP32實作

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 了解物聯網系統原理
能應用物聯網系統

courses.description: 課程內容包括: 國內外永續發展趨勢與管制措施，氣候變遷衝擊的調適與風險評估，溫室氣體盤查範疇與類別說明，活動數據收集與量化方法。課程中含實際演練組織型溫室氣體盤查案例與進行能源效率熱點案例計算。

syllabus.zh: 1.國際/國內永續發展趨勢與規範 2.氣候變遷調適趨勢與風險評估3.溫室氣體盤查範疇 4.活動數據收集與量化方法 5組織型溫室氣體盤查演練6.能源效率熱點簡介與計算
syllabus.en: 1. International/domestic sustainable development trends and regulations 2. Climate change adaptation trends and its risk assessment3. Scopes of greenhouse gas inventory 4. Activity data collection and quantification methods. 5. Practices of organization level greenhouse gas inventory. 6. Introduction to energy efficiency hotspots and its calculation

courses.weeklySchedule: 1-3週: 國際/國內永續發展趨勢與規範4-6週: 氣候變遷調適趨勢與風險評估7-9週: 溫室氣體盤查範疇10-12週: 活動數據收集與量化方法13-15週: 組織型溫室氣體盤查演練16-18週: 能源效率熱點簡介與計算

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 能瞭解國內外永續發展趨勢與管制措施。
能瞭解氣候變遷衝擊的調適與相關風險評估。
能實作計算組織型溫室氣體盤查之案例。
能實作工廠能源效率熱點之案例。

courses.referenceBooks: 自編教材
courses.rules: 1.平時上課會不定時小考及抽問。2.上課睡覺及滑手機的同學要扣平時成績。

courses.description: 本課程旨在探討永續金融與管理的概念、原則和執行，包括：國際趨勢因應與政策介紹、瞭解企業社會責任、永續金融發展策略、ESG資訊揭露與評估、氣候變化因應等主題，以期建立學生企業社會責任觀念，應用永續投融資，協助企業邁向永續發展並兼顧低碳轉型，達到金融、企業與社會環境共生共榮。

syllabus.zh: 1.永續金融綜論2.永續金融趨勢與政策3.永續金融實務4.永續金融資訊揭露5.永續管理實務6.氣候金融與風險管理7.溫室氣體盤查與碳權管理
syllabus.en: 1. Overview of sustainable finance2. The trends and policies of sustainable finance 3. The practice of sustainable finance4. Information disclosure of sustainable finance5. The practice of sustainable management6. Climate finance and risk management7. Greenhouse gas inventory and carbon emission credit management

teachingAndAssessment.objective: 能瞭解永續金融與管理的基本學理
能應用方法協助企業低碳轉型
